meanings.definition: A person who arranges and coordinates events or activities.
meanings.sent1: The organizers of the school play made sure everyone knew their roles.
meanings.sent2: The event organizers worked hard to make the concert a success.
meanings.sent3: The organizers of the picnic forgot to bring the food, so it turned into a game of 'find the nearest restaurant'.
meanings.sent4: The organizers of the charity event were the unsung heroes behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The organizers of the marathon set up water stations along the route for the runners.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used to keep items in order or arranged neatly.
meanings.sent1: She used small organizers to keep her art supplies tidy.
meanings.sent2: The desk organizer helped keep all the pens and pencils in one place.
meanings.sent3: The closet organizer collapsed under the weight of too many clothes.
meanings.sent4: The toolbox organizer made it easy to find the right screwdriver quickly.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen drawer organizer kept the utensils neatly separated and easy to find.

meanings.definition: A group or association that plans and oversees a particular event or activity.
meanings.sent1: The organizers of the charity walk raised funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent2: The student organizers of the school dance decorated the gym beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The organizers of the beach cleanup found a message in a bottle from a mysterious 'Captain Cleanup'.
meanings.sent4: The organizers of the music festival transformed an empty field into a lively concert venue.
meanings.sent5: The organizers of the art exhibition carefully curated each piece for display.
